{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3045775,"name":"Sean Lavery","username":"Lil_Lavery","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/lil_lavery/{size}/65226_2.png","created_at":"2022-04-18T02:44:39.167Z","cooked":"

Spin-off of the general COTS Review thread since its such a major system overhaul, did your team use the new REV Control System in 2022? What did you think of it? What challenges did you encounter? What benefits did you incur? What did you miss from the CTRE control system? What would you want changed going forwards? Will you be sticking with it in 2023 and would you suggest it to other teams?

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":54,"updated_at":"2022-04-18T02:44:49.122Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":106,"reads":640,"readers_count":639,"score":658.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":409213,"topic_slug":"2022-rev-control-system-electronics-reviews","display_username":"Sean Lavery","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://www.chiefdelphi.com/t/2020-2022-cots-reviews/409212","internal":true,"reflection":false,"title":"2020-2022 COTS Reviews","clicks":28}],"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":2514,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"FRC 1712"},"post_url":"/t/2022-rev-control-system-electronics-reviews/409213/1","custom_user_title":"FRC 1712","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":3045778,"name":"Rishi Rao","username":"22raor","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/22raor/{size}/127971_2.png","created_at":"2022-04-18T02:46:59.167Z","cooked":"

I wish you could access the interfaces of Rev devices remotely like in Phoenix Tuner.

","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"posts_count":54,"updated_at":"2022-04-18T02:46:59.167Z","reply_count":2,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":629,"readers_count":628,"score":320.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":409213,"topic_slug":"2022-rev-control-system-electronics-reviews","display_username":"Rishi Rao","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":15}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":41300,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"8429 Mentor | 4926 Alum"},"post_url":"/t/2022-rev-control-system-electronics-reviews/409213/2","custom_user_title":"8429 Mentor | 4926 Alum","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":12},{"id":"point_up","type":"emoji","count":3}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":15,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3045783,"name":"Nate","username":"ns3517","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/ns3517/{size}/8364_2.png","created_at":"2022-04-18T02:49:30.562Z","cooked":"

We used the new control systems. I really liked it with the exceptions of a few minor issues. This was expected though.

So for the Rev pdh we really enjoyed the new wago lever connection option and the ability to have all 40amp breakers.
The small issue was that it has led indicators to help indicate faults and those are not completely debugged so often times it displays faults that aren’t there. It’s not a major issue you just ignore the lights.

For the pch it was a little different. The solenoid slots are smaller and much more compact making it harder to get the wires in. We also had a faulty pch but Rev was great with sending a replacement for us.

Overall we enjoyed the new control system more then the last. The minor issues were minor and expected with a brand new system.

","post_number":3,"post_type":1,"posts_count":54,"updated_at":"2022-04-18T02:49:30.562Z","reply_count":2,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":2,"reads":617,"readers_count":616,"score":143.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":409213,"topic_slug":"2022-rev-control-system-electronics-reviews","display_username":"Nate","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":25567,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Yeah-Yeah"},"post_url":"/t/2022-rev-control-system-electronics-reviews/409213/3","custom_user_title":"Yeah-Yeah","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3045785,"name":"Nate","username":"ns3517","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/ns3517/{size}/8364_2.png","created_at":"2022-04-18T02:49:53.104Z","cooked":"

I actually agree with this. That would be awesome

","post_number":4,"post_type":1,"posts_count":54,"updated_at":"2022-04-18T02:49:53.104Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":2,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":2,"reads":586,"readers_count":585,"score":157.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":409213,"topic_slug":"2022-rev-control-system-electronics-reviews","display_username":"Nate","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":41300,"username":"22raor","name":"Rishi Rao","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/22raor/{size}/127971_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":2}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":25567,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Yeah-Yeah"},"post_url":"/t/2022-rev-control-system-electronics-reviews/409213/4","custom_user_title":"Yeah-Yeah","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":2}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":2,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3045792,"name":"","username":"Alex_Y","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/a/82dd89/{size}.png","created_at":"2022-04-18T02:54:04.289Z","cooked":"

We have not had good luck with the rev control system.

While the REV pdh is nice mechanically, the firmware is really bad. We spend a long time trying to debug every single sticky fault going off while before realizing that the entire sticky fault system is defective. However, the volt meter is really nice, and the wago connectors are so much easier to use. I think we will continue using the rev pdh however I really hope the firmware gets fixed.

Our rev pneumatic hub was defective. The positive power terminal frequently came loose and would cause us to lose all pneumatics in multiple matches with the fuse still intact. We also frequently blew fuses with the rev PH even after rewiring the bot. I also hate the connectors on it, the 45 degree angle makes it difficult to gauge the strip length and its really annoying to install wires. After replacing it with the CTRE pneumatic module, all these problems went away. Would strongly avoid using the PH.

","post_number":5,"post_type":1,"posts_count":54,"updated_at":"2022-04-18T03:05:24.358Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":2,"reads":575,"readers_count":574,"score":145.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":409213,"topic_slug":"2022-rev-control-system-electronics-reviews","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":2,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":50219,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/2022-rev-control-system-electronics-reviews/409213/5","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3045794,"name":"Rahul Yarlagadda","username":"Knufire","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/knufire/{size}/67820_2.png","created_at":"2022-04-18T02:56:31.622Z","cooked":"
Alex_Y:

we frequently blew fuses with the rev PH even after rewiring the bot

What fuses? We definitely blew 15A fuses pretty regularly, and occasionally did blow a 20A fuse as well. The suggestion from REV was to wire the PH to a 20A resetting breaker and the issues stopped after that for us.

We were blowing both 15a and 20a fuses. After swapping to a CTRE pneumatic controller in the middle of our second district event, we haven’t blown a fuse since.

","post_number":7,"post_type":1,"posts_count":54,"updated_at":"2022-04-18T02:57:58.445Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":6,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":536,"readers_count":535,"score":117.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":409213,"topic_slug":"2022-rev-control-system-electronics-reviews","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":12760,"username":"Knufire","name":"Rahul Yarlagadda","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/knufire/{size}/67820_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":50219,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/2022-rev-control-system-electronics-reviews/409213/7","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3045799,"name":"Ryan Blue","username":"Ryan_Blue","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/ryan_blue/{size}/174016_2.png","created_at":"2022-04-18T03:04:13.044Z","cooked":"

REV changed their recommendation pretty recently to use it with a 20a breaker instead of the fuse. It looks like they have some fixes ready in firmware for it, but didn’t want to push an update in the middle of the season.

","post_number":8,"post_type":1,"posts_count":54,"updated_at":"2022-04-18T03:04:13.044Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":7,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":536,"readers_count":535,"score":117.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":409213,"topic_slug":"2022-rev-control-system-electronics-reviews","display_username":"Ryan Blue","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":50219,"username":"Alex_Y","name":"","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/a/82dd89/{size}.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":29846,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"WPILib Dev | 1024 Mentor"},"post_url":"/t/2022-rev-control-system-electronics-reviews/409213/8","custom_user_title":"WPILib Dev | 1024 Mentor","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3045800,"name":"Rahul Yarlagadda","username":"Knufire","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/knufire/{size}/67820_2.png","created_at":"2022-04-18T03:04:45.136Z","cooked":"

Original source for reference:

Pneumatic Fuse keeps blowing Team 3970 Pneumatics
The current draw on the Viar90 compressors has ranged wildly. As others have stated, putting this on a 20A channel with a resetting breaker is the fool proof way to make sure you don’t have an issue. We have a few things on the Firmware side that we are working on that should remediate this issue for future seasons, but for now the 20A resetting breaker is our recommendation.
","post_number":9,"post_type":1,"posts_count":54,"updated_at":"2022-04-18T03:04:45.136Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":8,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":531,"readers_count":530,"score":171.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":409213,"topic_slug":"2022-rev-control-system-electronics-reviews","display_username":"Rahul Yarlagadda","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://www.chiefdelphi.com/t/pneumatic-fuse-keeps-blowing-team-3970/408412/10","internal":true,"reflection":false,"title":"Pneumatic Fuse keeps blowing Team 3970","clicks":0}],"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":29846,"username":"Ryan_Blue","name":"Ryan Blue","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/ryan_blue/{size}/174016_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":4}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":12760,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"7457 Mentor"},"post_url":"/t/2022-rev-control-system-electronics-reviews/409213/9","custom_user_title":"7457 Mentor","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":4}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":4,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3045862,"name":"","username":"Akash_Rastogi","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/akash_rastogi/{size}/169937_2.png","created_at":"2022-04-18T05:06:41.255Z","cooked":"
ns3517:

For the pch it was a little different. The solenoid slots are smaller and much more compact making it harder to get the wires in.

This is my biggest gripe with the REV hardware. Wiring that thing took too much patience and small steady hands. On several occasions I just wanted to go back to the ctre PCM. I’ll let @Molly_Connolly give our overall feedback though as she handled electrical.

","post_number":10,"post_type":1,"posts_count":54,"updated_at":"2022-04-18T05:06:55.649Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":3,"quote_count":1,"incoming_link_count":2,"reads":500,"readers_count":499,"score":145.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":409213,"topic_slug":"2022-rev-control-system-electronics-reviews","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":2}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":8002,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"177 & 429 | #TeamWCP| #TeamThrifty"},"post_url":"/t/2022-rev-control-system-electronics-reviews/409213/10","custom_user_title":"177 & 429 | #TeamWCP| #TeamThrifty","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":2}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":2,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3045877,"name":"s-neff","username":"s-neff","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/s-neff/{size}/9062_2.png","created_at":"2022-04-18T05:36:17.363Z","cooked":"

Love the new slots and other features on PDH. We ignored the sticky faults, and they didn’t affect match play. The LED indicator actually worked as designed to identify the blown 20A PCH fuse. The power wiring cage clamps were awesome, even deep in the belly pan we could teach new students to wire to it no problem.

PCH was a struggle. It needs bigger connectors everywhere, we couldn’t fit our standard ferrules into anything and once PCH was on the robot with restricted hand access/visibility, I couldn’t successfully teach students how to wire into it. It took some nudging to get the terminals to pass a pull test.
We had one 20A fuse failure as well, fortunately between our last qualifier and first quarterfinal so some time to fix, but we were climbing with air… Couldn’t have another in-match failure.
I’m currently planning to revert to the PCM.

I’m kinda torn on the radio power module. I liked it, aesthetically, but we did have one communication failure and I have to assume it had to do with the Ethernet ports getting beaten up. Our radio came loose in multiple matches, this is 100% not the RPM fault, but I would have really liked the ability to run redundant power connections like we used to.

Across the board I am looking for a new 18awg ferrule solution for CAN since the signal level cage clamps rev selected don’t fit our weidmuller tool profile. I’ve got some candidates, we’ll figure it out.

","post_number":11,"post_type":1,"posts_count":54,"updated_at":"2022-04-18T05:36:17.363Z","reply_count":2,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":2,"reads":485,"readers_count":484,"score":147.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":409213,"topic_slug":"2022-rev-control-system-electronics-reviews","display_username":"s-neff","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":3}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":28019,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/2022-rev-control-system-electronics-reviews/409213/11","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":2},{"id":"100","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":3,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3045914,"name":"Ryan Blue","username":"Ryan_Blue","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/ryan_blue/{size}/174016_2.png","created_at":"2022-04-18T10:02:13.850Z","cooked":"
s-neff:

18awg

You run CAN over 18 gauge wire?

","post_number":12,"post_type":1,"posts_count":54,"updated_at":"2022-04-18T10:02:13.850Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":11,"quote_count":1,"incoming_link_count":2,"reads":443,"readers_count":442,"score":118.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":409213,"topic_slug":"2022-rev-control-system-electronics-reviews","display_username":"Ryan Blue","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":29846,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"WPILib Dev | 1024 Mentor"},"post_url":"/t/2022-rev-control-system-electronics-reviews/409213/12","custom_user_title":"WPILib Dev | 1024 Mentor","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3045943,"name":"Allen Nuttle","username":"nuttle","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/nuttle/{size}/124105_2.png","created_at":"2022-04-18T12:25:47.881Z","cooked":"

The team I work with had very good experiences overall. We ran the new PDH/PH/RPM, facing down. I totally get the points about wiring the PH solenoid connectors, but these were fine for us – we got non-insulated WAGO ferrules and WAGO crimpers in the sizes specified for all of these connectors. The PH solenoid ones were very small. Had we not done this, I am sure that these would have been pain points. There are several different sizes to deal with, which makes it harder to get everything right.

We didn’t have any electrical problems in three events (two district events plus district champs). As a CSA, I am pretty sensitive to radio power problems and would have liked to be able to do dual wiring here – but we never lost comms or had any control system reboots. This is with solid electrical construction. A major evaluation criteria is how likely various teams are to get here when using these components.

For teams that use wires that come in the KoP (or just in general), there’s a whole lot of variation here. I did see one team have the main power come out of the PDH – they had tinned the end, I think with lead-free solder, making it a smooth and hard, round solid mass. I’ve seen pics here on CD of teams using the wrong wire sizes (and force) and damaging PH connectors.

So it’s clearly possible to get bad results. It might even be a bit easier in some cases. But, there are trade-offs. For example, I have seen teams lose the lock washers on the screw-based main power terminals – or just not tighten these enough. The cage clamp connectors eliminate this particular problem.

It always bothers me how many teams have radio or roboRIO reboots because of less than robust electrical construction. I’d like to see more guidance on avoiding these issues. The REV stuff might represent a step forward here, but it’s tough to say without lots of data. I didn’t see many less experienced teams using the new stuff this season, so it’s difficult to say anything here. I do think there needs to be more advice on getting the electrical construction right in any case, and this hasn’t really changed with the new components. Plus, there’s still the main breaker, battery, etc. that are unchanged.

So, new breakers were great (even upside down), more slots were great, everything was very reliable for us. But, one set of things that sometimes go wrong, particularly across a wide variety of teams, has been swapped for another. The overall change as more teams use these components will probably come down to making it harder to go wrong, either though more instructions or making some things more tolerant (PH connectors, for example).

The smaller sizes were also helpful for our robot, allowing for very compact control and power distribution.

","post_number":13,"post_type":1,"posts_count":54,"updated_at":"2022-04-18T12:26:42.538Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":435,"readers_count":434,"score":122.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":409213,"topic_slug":"2022-rev-control-system-electronics-reviews","display_username":"Allen Nuttle","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":2}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":14283,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/2022-rev-control-system-electronics-reviews/409213/13","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":2}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":2,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3045971,"name":"Jack Tajkef","username":"jacktajkef","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/jacktajkef/{size}/193592_2.png","created_at":"2022-04-18T13:08:42.912Z","cooked":"

We also had an issue with the RPM where we killed the ethernet mid match after a big hit. The ethernet cable came out of the port and it has never worked since. We got the cable back in but it only powers the radio, no data. We ended up running a second line from the rio to our radio as a quick fix. RPM was good while it lasted, and it did last for 1.5 regionals.

","post_number":14,"post_type":1,"posts_count":54,"updated_at":"2022-04-18T13:11:54.494Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":11,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":395,"readers_count":394,"score":99.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":409213,"topic_slug":"2022-rev-control-system-electronics-reviews","display_username":"Jack Tajkef","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":28019,"username":"s-neff","name":"s-neff","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/s-neff/{size}/9062_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":51555,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Team 7415 | President"},"post_url":"/t/2022-rev-control-system-electronics-reviews/409213/14","custom_user_title":"Team 7415 | President","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3046051,"name":"Fields","username":"Fields","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/fields/{size}/7873_2.png","created_at":"2022-04-18T14:20:40.197Z","cooked":"

Echoing a lot of this for us.

  • Power Dist Hub
    • Mechanically great
    • Some firmware issues, but no show stoppers
  • Pneumatic Cont Hub
    • After several tries we switched back to the CTRE since it was nearly impossible to wire.
    • Small is nice until it is too small, and honestly we like the push to connect because it can get tight around the PCH making levers impossible to operate.
  • Radio Power Module
    • The jury is still out on this one. Convenient wiring, but we temp lost power to the radio twice on the field.
    • The field crew recommended using both the ethernet connector and separate power connector in place for backup, but said that option wasn’t available to do with the new RPM
","post_number":15,"post_type":1,"posts_count":54,"updated_at":"2022-04-18T14:20:40.197Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":3,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":389,"readers_count":388,"score":82.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":409213,"topic_slug":"2022-rev-control-system-electronics-reviews","display_username":"Fields","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":25567,"username":"ns3517","name":"Nate","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/ns3517/{size}/8364_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":23888,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Charge Onward"},"post_url":"/t/2022-rev-control-system-electronics-reviews/409213/15","custom_user_title":"Charge Onward","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3046061,"name":"Lexeo","username":"Lexeo","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/lexeo/{size}/160041_2.png","created_at":"2022-04-18T14:31:39.169Z","cooked":"

Echoing a lot of the things here

The PDP is great if you ignore the weirdness of the faults (this was easy for us to ignore). Very happy with it.

The RPM is a little questionable. In principle, it is fantastic. It held up fine for us, and is simple to wire. The Ethernet jacks used appear to be kind of cheap, and we aren’t super confident in them long-term. I also wish there was a way to access the 18V out for a redundant power.

The PCM worked fine…but was rough mechanically. I liked the software because it made debugging easy. I could move solenoids around through USB, without a robot. This was great.
The connectors on this are way to small. I really want to use ferrules on those spring loaded connectors…but I cannot on the current board. We have very seasoned electrical mentors who help our students, and they were able to wire it well enough, but I worry about teams without access to such mentors.

I’d really like to see a REV PDP lite, where they make the connectors bigger, and just include half as many solenoid outputs. That would be easier to use in my opinion.

","post_number":16,"post_type":1,"posts_count":54,"updated_at":"2022-04-18T14:31:39.169Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":2,"reads":381,"readers_count":380,"score":101.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":409213,"topic_slug":"2022-rev-control-system-electronics-reviews","display_username":"Lexeo","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":25373,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Team 4272 Lead Mentor and Head Robot Mentor"},"post_url":"/t/2022-rev-control-system-electronics-reviews/409213/16","custom_user_title":"Team 4272 Lead Mentor and Head Robot Mentor","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3046065,"name":"page2067","username":"page2067","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/page2067/{size}/3748_2.png","created_at":"2022-04-18T14:34:25.255Z","cooked":"

Same for us, after wasting a shop session trying to get the PCH wired up we just went back to the PCM - the little wire connectors were a pain. - no reason for it.

We very much liked the PDH, and the radio power module worked well for us as well.

","post_number":17,"post_type":1,"posts_count":54,"updated_at":"2022-04-18T14:34:25.255Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":10,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":367,"readers_count":366,"score":73.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":409213,"topic_slug":"2022-rev-control-system-electronics-reviews","display_username":"page2067","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":8002,"username":"Akash_Rastogi","name":"","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/akash_rastogi/{size}/169937_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":10808,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/2022-rev-control-system-electronics-reviews/409213/17","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3046066,"name":"MrBasse","username":"MrBasse","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/mrbasse/{size}/65032_2.png","created_at":"2022-04-18T14:36:04.754Z","cooked":"

We experienced concerning issues where a spark max dropped off the CAN bus and every single REV product followed suit. Our CTRE products remained up and running just fine though. We haven’t had time to fully investigate yet, but I am much more a fan of soldered connections over a small plug for critical systems like CAN now.

Pneumatics were great, Power Module was great, RPM was a surprising good experience. But overall something in software/comms/wiring/integration with speed controllers has me scratching my head.

","post_number":18,"post_type":1,"posts_count":54,"updated_at":"2022-04-18T14:36:04.754Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":370,"readers_count":369,"score":79.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":409213,"topic_slug":"2022-rev-control-system-electronics-reviews","display_username":"MrBasse","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":16614,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"FRC #3572"},"post_url":"/t/2022-rev-control-system-electronics-reviews/409213/18","custom_user_title":"FRC #3572","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3046070,"name":"Chris_Elston","username":"Chris_Elston","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/chris_elston/{size}/256883_2.png","created_at":"2022-04-18T14:38:46.683Z","cooked":"

It’s been said a few times in here but my recommendations are:

  1. Bigger WAGO holes so a ferrule can fit on the smaller gauges wago levers, especially the PCM!
  2. Get RID of the WAGO lever for the main power to the PDP. This needs to be a LUG! The WAGO clamp is not enough, not tight enough to secure large gauge wire without extra means to keep it secure. We are using 4 GA with SB120 Andersons now to keep the heat away from the connectors.
  3. We had trouble with the PCM blowing fuses as well.

We didn’t have any software or firmware problems that we was aware of in Labview this season. Everything seemed to work good there.

","post_number":19,"post_type":1,"posts_count":54,"updated_at":"2022-04-18T14:38:46.683Z","reply_count":2,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":2,"reads":372,"readers_count":371,"score":154.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":409213,"topic_slug":"2022-rev-control-system-electronics-reviews","display_username":"Chris_Elston","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":7}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":3040,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/2022-rev-control-system-electronics-reviews/409213/19","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":4},{"id":"point_up","type":"emoji","count":3},{"id":"-1","type":"emoji","count":2}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":9,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3046076,"name":"Lexeo","username":"Lexeo","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/lexeo/{size}/160041_2.png","created_at":"2022-04-18T14:41:13.248Z","cooked":"

We had that problem too!!

Are you using CANcoders? We had a badly soldered wire were the 12V was touching one of our CAN wires, causing it to be charged. The CTRE devices worked fine, and the Rev devices did not. Probably due to the CAN chips being different.
